title: Microlearning Design for Enhancing Peer Assessment and Feedback Quality

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social science knowledge and digital device usage skills
context.additional_context: Learners engage in short-form learning modules and peer assessment activities using mobile devices, practicing critical thinking and feedback skills on advanced topics in social studies

learning_goals: Learners can provide specific and constructive peer feedback on topics related to social studies subjects.
Learners can evaluate peers' work according to feedback guidelines and apply core evaluation criteria with over 80% accuracy.

Learners can acquire linguistic expression skills for different feedback types and utilize three or more types (e.g., content improvement, structural suggestions, expression refinement) in actual assessment activities.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
